answerText: John Maxwell Coetzee[10] Both of those Coetzee works won the Man Booker Prize, as did this novel about a man who writes a letter to Wen Jiabao about his struggle to escape the rooster coop by killing Pinky Madam's husband, Ashok.
heading: Penn Bowl |2013 | 11 | 12 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This author wrote of a man with a cleft lip who builds a rickshaw to carry his mother to Prince Albert. [10] Name this author of The Life and Times of Michael K who wrote of David Lurie's seduction of Melanie Isaacs in Disgrace.
